1.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

1.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

1.str2: It becomes, is fitting to, is right. Apparently a primary verb; to tower up, i.e. to be suitable or proper.

1.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Feminine Singular
1.str2: From hugies; to have sound health, i.e. Be well; figuratively, to be uncorrupt.

2.str2: An old man, an ambassador. From the same as presbuteros; an old man.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Sober, not intoxicated (with wine), temperate, vigilant. Or nephalios from nepho; sober, i.e. circumspect.
Venerable, honorable, grave, serious, dignified. From sebomai; venerable, i.e. Honorable.
From the base of sozo and that of phren; safe in mind, i.e. Self-controlled.

2.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
2.str2: From hugies; to have sound health, i.e. Be well; figuratively, to be uncorrupt.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Endurance, steadfastness, patient waiting for. From hupomeno; cheerful endurance, constancy.

3.str2: An old woman. Feminine of presbutes; an old woman.
In like manner, likewise, just so. From hos and an adverb from autos; as thus, i.e. In the same way.
Suitable to a sacred character, reverent. From hieros and the same as prepo; reverent.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Behavior, conduct, deportment, demeanor. From kathistemi; properly, a position or condition, i.e. demeanor.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
From diaballo; a traducer; specially, Satan.
And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.

3.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Plural
3.str2: To enslave. From doulos; to enslave.
A teacher of that which is noble (honorable) and good. From kalos and didaskalos; a teacher of the right.

4.str2: In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

4.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
4.str2: To make sober-minded, admonish, control. From sophron; to make of sound mind, i.e. to discipline or correct.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Loving one's husband. From philos and aner; fond of man, i.e. Affectionate as a wife.
Loving one's children. From philos and teknon; fond of one's children, i.e. Maternal.

5.str2: From the base of sozo and that of phren; safe in mind, i.e. Self-controlled.
From the same as hagios; properly, clean, i.e. innocent, modest, perfect.
A keeper-at-home, a housekeeper. From oikos and ouros; a stayer at home, i.e. Domestically inclined.

5.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Plural
5.str2: From hupo and tasso; to subordinate; reflexively, to obey.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

5.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: From blasphemos; to vilify; specially, to speak impiously.

6.str2: In like manner, likewise, just so. From hos and an adverb from autos; as thus, i.e. In the same way.

6.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
6.str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
To be of sound mind, be sober-minded, exercise self-control. From sophron; to be of sound mind, i.e. Sane, moderate.

7.str2: From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

7.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
7.str2: From para and echo; to hold near, i.e. Present, afford, exhibit, furnish occasion.

7.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 2nd Person Singular

7.str2: From tupto; a die, i.e. a stamp or scar; by analogy, a shape, i.e. A statue, style or resemblance; specially, a sampler, i.e. A model or instance.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From aphthartos; incorruptibility; genitive, unending existence; genuineness.
Dignity, honor, gravity, seriousness. From semnos; venerableness, i.e. Probity.

8.str2: (a) sound, healthy, pure, whole, (b) wholesome. From the base of auzano; healthy, i.e. Well; figuratively, true.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
Not open to just rebuke; irreprehensible. Unblamable.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Opposite, opposed, contrary; the adversary. From enanti; opposite; figuratively, antagonistic.

8.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
8.str2: From en and the base of trope; to invert, i.e. in a good sense, to respect; or in a bad one, to confound.

8.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
8.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Worthless, wicked, base. Apparently a primary word; 'foul' or 'flawy', i.e. wicked.
(a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

8.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

From hupo and tasso; to subordinate; reflexively, to obey.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
A lord, master, or prince. Perhaps from deo and posis; an absolute ruler.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Acceptable, well-pleasing (especially to God), grateful. From eu and arestos; fully agreeable.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

9.str2: To speak or say in opposition, contradict (oppose, resist). From anti and lego; to dispute, refuse.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

Saving, bringing salvation; subst: salvation. Neuter of the same as soteria as noun; defender or defence.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

12.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
12.str2: From pais; to train up a child, i.e. Educate, or, discipline.

In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

Impiety, irreverence, ungodliness, wickedness. From asebes; impiety, i.e. wickedness.
From kosmos; terrene, literally or figuratively.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.

12.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
12.str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
Soberly, with moderation, prudently. Adverb from sophron; with sound mind, i.e. Moderately.
Justly, righteously. Adverb from dikaios; equitably.
Piously, religiously. Adverb from eusebes; piously.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.
Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
Appearing, manifestation, glorious display. From epiphanes; a manifestation, i.e. the advent of Christ.

Large, great, in the widest sense.

Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

14.str2: Apparently a primary word; a people.
From the present participle feminine of a compound of peri and eimi; being beyond usual, i.e. Special.

Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

15.str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

15.str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Instruction, command, order, authority. From epitasso; an injunction or decree; by implication, authoritativeness.
